subject: Re: My Progress
msgSnippet: I m still plugging away at my studies of Quickscript. I ve finished the Memrise couse with more than a million total points and more than twice as many points
messageBody:
I'm still plugging away at my studies of Quickscript. I've finished the Memrise couse with more than a million total points and more than twice as many points as the creator of the course. (It's very clear at what point he stopped doing the course, since the errors really start picking up about three quarters of the way in.)

As I reached the end, I started reading The Call of Cthulhu in Quickscript, but I think it's a bit too challenging. Lovecraft uses some very unusual vocabulary and sentence structure. There were times when i read a sentence perfectly but was certain I had made some mistake, since it sounded so odd in my head. Also, the text contains errors, and at this point, I'm tired of having to work around errors.

I can't seem to find any other texts online, though, other than a New Testament transcription, which really doesn't appeal to me. Does anyone know where I can get ahold of error-free texts written in Quickscript Junior in modern American English? Or do they just not exist?
